text: Anyone have any experience with Esper reanimator? Never built a reanimator in commander (somehow), and I'm trying to find the best balance of reanimation spells to targets.
I have experience with Grixis, Abzan, Orzhov and other colors reanimator. What are you currently working with?
kinda depends on the deck tbh
and if your commander is the target for reanimation or the reanimator
I tend to prefer reanimation engines or explosive reanimation vs single target.
ie, gonti vs chainer
<@UFZFBJN30> I think <@U8KTL6XME> built Yennett as Esper reanimator at one point.
Oloro reanimator to use the lifegain to power out the cheaper reanimating that loses you life etc.
Or Varina for a more aggressive build as well as an engine to get cards into the yard.
If the commander is Alesha, does that count as reanimator?
Just add red to Esper so you can get all those sweet Looting effects~
Plenty of looting in blue.
Currently planning to use Lady Evangela as Cmdr, so no interaction with theme
Blue does have Looting, but Red has better efficient and priced Looting imo
I was eyeing mass-reanimation, but I think I want the speed of single target. Like, turn 3 [[Sphinx of the Steel Wind]]

attachments.fallback: Sphinx of the Steel Wind {5}{W}{U}{B} // Artifact Creature — Sphinx // Flying, first strike, vigilance, lifelink, protection from red and from green // 6/6
attachments.text:
Artifact Creature — Sphinx
Flying, first strike, vigilance, lifelink, protection from red and from green
_No one has properly answered her favorite riddle: "Why should I spare your life?"_
*6/6*

text: Oh I haven't. I'm working on a pile of targets, a pile of spells, and a pile of looters. Again, just having trouble with the ratio to start with.
Also considering adding some mill to allow for options in all graveyards
Just add Red for Looting, and Green for self mill...:thinking_face:
In al seriousness though, I have a hard time balancing those too when it comes to Golgari and their sac stuff
If my commander isn’t the fulcrum of the deck I can’t balance the things that need balancing :disappointed:
Right! Then use Child of Alara as Cmdr, add in the gates package, and take out all the reanimator for lands.dec and there we go
Seriously, though, I have that same problem, too. But my desire to use [[Lady Evangela]] supercedes what the deck does at the moment

text: I'd say 1 reanimation effect per 2.5-3.5 targets. Ish. Maybe even more targets depending on the list, but I think that's a good starting place.
Why her so especially?
I like the terrible legends from Legends. For instance, my first article on Oakenshield
I just got an Evangela a few weeks ago, and have been debating the direction to take her
I actively avoided writing about as many of them as I could for Uncommonders XD
Oh yeah, I learned that lesson quickly based on feedback from that article.
People trolling you for not being boring is hardly what I would call "feedback"
When your deck uses two of the commanders from the Entropic Uprising precon,  [[kydele]] & [[Vial Smasher]], and it struggles with running out of gas, do you know what the/a solution is?

text: If you're doing Vial Smasher and Kydele, am I right in assuming it's big spells?
<https://archidekt.com/decks/66009#Whiteless_wheel_v5>
It's a wheel deck with an emphasis on discard effects.
And I thought, "Wheel deck means use Kydele."

Makes sense. It seems like you're not playing enough straight draw, though.  All of your wheels that say "discard your hands, then draw that many cards" are actually losing you a card while your opponents are keeping the same amount.
But that's a silly assumption, especially when I have plenty of experience that the deck usually has lots of mana with nothing to do with it.
Yeah, but the idea is that I'll have stuff like [[megrim]]

For sure, that's the game plan, but you said you're running out of gas. I'm just putting my theory as to why that is out there.
Yes.

text: I love wheels. Someone else's wheel has handed me so many games.
Maybe people don’t know how to play wheels right? Any time I cast a wheel there are groans and everyone is angry at me despite their new hand :joy:
All depends. People get attached to their hands and plans, even if they end up drawing new ones.
For me personally, I've probably been milled out by them more than won off of opposing player's wheels, but I play some greedy decks that dig deep.
There's always [[notion thief]]
A lot of people are bad at wheels

attachments.fallback: Notion Thief {2}{U}{B} // Creature — Human Rogue // Flash // If an opponent would draw a card except the first one they draw in each of their draw steps, instead that player skips that draw and you draw a card. // 3/1
attachments.text:
Creature — Human Rogue
Flash
If an opponent would draw a card except the first one they draw in each of their draw steps, instead that player skips that draw and you draw a card.
*3/1*
attachments.title: Notion Thief {2}{U}{B}

text: But it's also hard to use them well too. I think they're heavily overrated, outside the obvious Nekusar and Locust God synergies
Actually it's not even that they're bad at it, it's that there's a limited window when they're not risky, and people aren't patient about cards that you shouldn't cast in 90% of situations.
My solution to that is to avoid running cards that are dead in hand 90% of the time, but that's me.
I understand that, and that’s how I evaluate cards most of the time, but I do think that it may be a bit heavy handed in this regard. I completely get why you would think that.
21 new cards for people wanting to kill you vs 7 for you is really tricky to make work in your advantage I think
There times and decks where it's necessary true enough
They also want to kill two other people at the table. Don't underestimate politics.
Agreed, which is why I've pretty much avoided the strategy for the most part. I do play [[Memory jar]] in Xantcha Mass Discard, and a "discard your hand, draw that many cards" effect in cycling.

attachments.fallback: Memory Jar {5} // Artifact // {T}, Sacrifice Memory Jar: Each player exiles all cards from their hand face down and draws seven cards. At the beginning of the next end step, each player discards their hand and returns to their hand each card they exiled this way.
attachments.text:
Artifact
{T}, Sacrifice Memory Jar: Each player exiles all cards from their hand face down and draws seven cards. At the beginning of the next end step, each player discards their hand and returns to their hand each card they exiled this way.
attachments.title: Memory Jar {5}

text: But that's it.
The other two people aren't the threat that you are
It's not a 3-on-1 game.
It can be, though... people get offended easily.
Maybe in your pods.
It's always a 3-on-1 game. The world is cruel place.
I'm just a bumbly little value player.
I don’t want to play the “git gud” card, but part of the skill and finesse of using a wheel is being able to leverage all bits of it to your advantage.
It's the EDH corollary to the poker "if you don't see the sucker at the table, you're the sucker." If it's not 3 v 1, or not gonna be that soon then you're the soft target
I’m talking things like Wheel of Fortune and other low cost ones that you can get value off of.
You shouldn’t be wheeling when you just have it, but we add cards like enchantment removal even if they aren’t usable all the time
Dana, do you gun for the soft targets first, or the most threatening player?
There is something to say for having the ability to play a sweeping spell like that
There's a corollary to "wow, that card is doing a lot for them, but I can't justify playing removal on it because something worse is here/coming."
Depends on the situation
That being said, I will always try to opt for pure card advantage before putting a wheel in. I’m not arguing that it is a bit situational.
Switching gears: I'm debating swapping Precognitive Perception for Archmage's Charm. Thoughts?
In Blue Braids.

I'm just saying I've probably seen 10 bad wheels for every 1 good one, outside obvious commander synergy. I think they're the kind of effect makes people think they're gonna be the ones that are clever enough to make it work.
I can get behind that
I definitely think I'm being clever. Probably more clever than I actually am.
:point_up:
I think I’m a Jeskai monk when I’m really a Mardu Hordechief

I never played Precog Perception, because it looked like the kind of card like Return to Dust where you almost never cast it as anything but a sorcery, and if I'm casting it as a sorcery 95% of the time then I'd probalby just want to run Recurring Insight or something. That said, I don't know if it actually played that way or not.
I usually cast it as a sorcery
I run Perception in Saheeli Spaghetti just because it is really good for filtering out dead draws/refilling my hand, since that deck has an average cmc of 4 1/2
In Braids I could afford to.
Because she cheats in the biggest thing I would have cast.

I think Archmage's Charm is gonna play like a draw spell that might work out really well if you change your mind during a spin around the table. Someone casts a Hangarback for 12 you take it, or drops a Blightsteel you counter it, and if those things don't happen you draw your 2 for three and are pretty happy with that too.
But I haven't played it yet, so that might not be the case. That's just a guess.
I’d think maybe run both? I’m not sure Perception is the cut. It’s digging power is so good
That's basically what I was thinking for it too, Dana. That's why I'm considering swapping it with a draw spell rather than a counter.
I might have Recurring Insight in the deck. Maybe that's the cut.
I could get behind that one in a heartbeat
I adore Recurring Insight, but there's just been too many times I've top-decked it on T14 or something with one opponent holding 2 cards
But man it feels good the times someone is holding 11
If you give Recurring Insight a pass, but not Wheel of Fortune, I’m going to be so upset with you, Dana :joy:
Oh I'm not running RI anymore
But it was a pet card for a long time
Thank goodness
I do still think Overwhelming Intellect is underappreciated as a draw spell
It's probably a bit meta dependant though
[[overwhelming intellect]]

attachments.text:
Instant
Counter target creature spell. Draw cards equal to that spell's converted mana cost.

text: I’m not down on it, but I’m not okay with it either. If it didn’t specify creature, I’d be on it all day. 6 mana draw 6? I’m in
It being conditional kinda makes me more cautious
Intellect would draw me 3 cards most of the time.
Three cards and stopping an Ewit or most commanders isn't a bad deal for six mana at instant speed. That's only one more than Precog
And that's probably the bottom end.
I've hit three mana commanders often enough and never felt bad about that trade. I've hit more than a few Thraxes or Dromokas or Aurelia's too.
It’s something I’m going to put on my watch list as a possible include to my decks if I ever come across one

text: There are others, but those are the main ones.
If your deck has discard synergies that are in play at any level of consistency, probably. The problem then is are you in a meta where you’re gonna get punished for playing devoted discard.
Nope: my meta plays once a month, if we're lucky. Lol
Not often enough for folks to respond to others' decks.
Totally makes sense then
That being said, as I indicated at the start of this conversation, this deck has been disappointing for a long time; maybe if it started working better, the meta might start responding.

See, if we're talking about playing wheels as just cards without synergy, then that seems bad to me for two reasons: 1) It's playing staples for the sake of playing staples, 2) by definition, without synergy you are always getting the least amount of advantage from a wheel effect.
Unless you have [[notion thief]]

text: For instance, it says that Rakdos, Showstopper is in 50% of 2 decks.
We dont include decks in the denominator if they were submitted before the printing of the card
So in this case 4 decks were submitted before rakdos showstopper and 2 after
